reviews.text: Beautiful. Roads in great condition (in July when we went). Picnic areas were fabulous. Cider donuts at Peak were delicious. Will definitely come back.
Really high up. The road on the way was sketchy, even in the summer. At the top I got some donuts which really hit the spot! Lots of snow and ice at the top. Great views!
Make sure to take some oxygen with you if you haven't been in the area for a few days. Awesome views though. Chances of wintry mixes even in August.
Wow. Come prepared, it's cold even in the middle of summer. Worth the drive. Donuts at the top! The views are amazing.
This is truly a breathtaking experience! The view is unimaginable on a clear day. Even with partial cloud cover it can add a little extra!

We did the Lantern tour and it was worth every penny of the purchase. Super fun, interesting and even spooky at times. Would recommend to anyone looking to have a good time. The views aren't as good as the lit portion as you only have small little candle style lanterns but it was so fun. If you're tall like me (6'2) the small part in the beginning is pretty tight but doable. Our guide was Lexi and she was super cool and informative. Will be back next time we're in town.

Did the lantern tour with Lexy, and she was awesome! Her whole attitude was fun and silly :) She told us fun history facts and spooky stories. We were kinda late, (sorry about that friends!) But they were awesome enough to catch us up with the group. Definitely worth going!

Place is beautiful and with a lot of picturesque views. There's a fee for entry but the guide is totally fun to be with and roam around the caves. It also has adventurous sports which might be cool for some daredevils out there.
They are a bit small, so claustrophobia might kick in for some people but a great place to take kids and show them some geological marvels. Take care of the time as everything closes by 5 pm.

The staff at the Cave of The Winds was amazing! Our cave tour with John the hippie was amazing. He was very accommodating to our family! His jokes were awesome and the kids enjoyed them! The staff at the above ground adventures were amazing with all of us, especially those a little unsure about the heights! My youngest sons highlight of the day was when John went on the Bat-a-pult with him because no one in our group wanted to ride again! We will definitely be back the next time we visit Colorado again!

Went on the Lantern Tour with my bestfriend, we had Lexy as our tour guide. She was absolutely fantastic, she made it fun and suspenseful.  She has great character and is full of positivity. I will be going again and I really hope to get her next time! I do recommend this tour to anyone who is interested in dark and scary activities! 👍🏼 😊

Absolutely stunning! There is a trolley to take up to the falls or you can take a short hike up, I say about 1 mile, maybe. For myself, I saved my energy to climb the 200 stairs to the top of the falls, well worth the climb. Once up top, there are some of the most breathtaking views I have ever seen. There is a trail as well if you're not to wore out from the climb up. I felt going down was more scary than going up. It was wet from melting snow on the day I went, so that made it a bit more scary to me. Plus the stairs are steep, I held on to both rails for safety. My friends had no issues with going down, don't want to scare anyone cause it truly is worth it and I definitely would climb them again. It looks like in the summer they open up concession stands along the way up the mountain. There is also a restaurant at the bottom of the waterfall.

Fantastic views! Make sure to park at the shuttle pickup parking lot. Really good shuttle service to get to the falls, and an elevator to the viewing/observation platform. Have to walk up 200+ stairs to get to the top of the falls, but it's beautiful! The hiking trails are at the top of the falls. Definitely earns their slogan about being the most scenic mile in Colorado.

Beautiful breathtaking views!  This place was so amazing. If your group can't handle the stairs and the hike, you may want to skip, though. 15pp entry (military and child discounts are available) with parking included. Some choose to only view the falls and gift shops, or take the elevator up to the eagles nest, but if you're up for a ~1 hr hike, you really can't beat the view from the top.

Very nice place to make some memories with the family. Cute little photograph opportunities, so definitely bring the camera. There is a restaurant to eat at but we did not visit it. The stairs that you climb to go up the side of the waterfall can be intimidating but once you make it up, you'll be fine. I wouldn't recommend small small children  or very elderly making the climb up, one wrong step and it can be bad. Overall it was very nice and we had a great Saturday visit.

We picked up the free tram from the offsite parking lot that drops off at the entrance gate.   It was $15/adult.  From there, we walked about a mile back into the canyon. We climbed the 200 stairs to the Lookout point (elevator available).  There is a separate set of 200 stairs that go along the waterfall.  At the top there are more hiking trails available.  We went to midnight falls,  but the trail was muddy and slippery ( still snow on the ground).  The zip lines were not open (summer only).  The whole place was peaceful and beautiful (expect crowds in the summer).  Food and restrooms available.

Surrounding myself around Greatness!! This is where the best of the best in America Train, sleep and eat!! I still cant believe I was there. If you like sports this is a must visit place. Being able to stop and see mountains anytime looking to the west is sooo cool.
I stayed here to train for a week. Everything about the place was great. Great food, friendly staff, and most of all, AMAZING facilities!

Went on the tour with my youth group and had an amazing time on the tour. The guide was informative and engaging and we even got to talk to a real Olympic wrestler who we met outside the athletes residences. 
      To top it all off the group we were with rented out the actual gym. How about playing basketball on the same court Lebron, KD, and Curry practiced on. Awesome.
       I also picked up a fire shirt from the gift shop.
💯🏀🤼‍♂️🇺🇸
Came for a National Judo tournament. This place is awesome!
Awesome tour given by Kasey. He was very informative and gave detailed answers to all of our questions! Can’t wait to go back with my family!

Love this stadium and base. Just visited falcon stadium for the second time to watch my son participate in the state marching band competition and it just really impresses me on how great the bands sound inside the stadium! 

Ample parking just outside the gates and everything is very easily accessible. HUGE stadium monitors. I really want to catch a college football game here!
We're fortunate to have a branch of the Armed Forces based in Colorado.  The Air Force Academy campus as well as a Falcons game should be on everyone's bucket list in Colorado.

Attending an Air Force football game is a  great experience. The Wings of Blue parachute team, the military aircraft flyovers, the band, the Falcon performance at halftime, the Cadet march-on and all the other activities, including the game, are a one of a kind experience! So much more than just a football game!
A great place for fall football, just make sure you get there early.  The games are always exciting.

Great field. Good food. It's only metal bleachers no seats so bring a blanket or cardboard so you don't freeze. They have rental bleacher seat for 6 bucks too. The sound has too much reverb so it's hard to hear what's going on. But other than that is an awesome stadium.
I loved this tour. They have everything you would like to know about rodeos. Great exhibits and pictures. Wonderful information to go with the exhibits and pictures.

Went to this museum with some friends after leaving hospital, they provided a wheelchair and made me feel very welcome. As I am a horse person as long as I can think I enjoyed all the displays and would love to revisit when I get the chance, this place is a must see for everyone who loves horses,rodeo and the western lifestyle.
I've driven past it may times and have never been in. I would reccomend it to anyone with a little time on their hands. Very interesting!
Much bigger then you would think! My husdand really enjoyed it. A must visit for any rodeo fan!
Very niche museum with (from what I could tell) a comprehensive collection and tribute to the rodeo!
This place is so cool! It is a great value and a lot of historical artifacts. The layout is great and the kids had a lot of fun. The gift shop is not overpriced and they had some cool things.
This was a fun walk down the boardwalks of history! Admission was super reasonable. Self guided, so you can take as long as you like. Great informational movie at the end of the tour. I recommend it!

I honestly thought this place would be hokey, because it is billed as a ghost town, but it was very nice!  Under a large building they've constructed a makeshift western town containing stage coaches, buggies, etc.  They have shops made like in the old west, some of which one can enter.  Be sure and buy a bottle of sasparilla from the gift shop.  I liked my visit!

Our guests were blown away by this unexpected venue, but our budget was not! The setting is already great and required very little on my part to create a fun and inviting atmosphere for our organization's Christmas party. The kids were thoroughly entertained which enabled their parents to have a better time. Guests loved bellying up to the bar in the saloon and strolling down the boardwalk to view the exhibits. The staff was extremely helpful and I loved the flexibility at this venue. We weren't tied to a specific menu or caterer which saved us a small fortune. Additionally, we were able to utilize the saloon to serve beer that we selected and brought in. Overall, I was thrilled with this venue (as were our guests) and would recommend it to anyone looking to host a memorable event; even on a budget.

I feel as though there was more activity and it was busier when I was younger. Took my kids today with my husband and it seemed a little boring and dry. Best part was letting my kids pick out candy and a birthday gift fir their great great grandma.
Took a BUNCH of small electronics. The process was very fast, employees were great. HIGHLY recommend them over some big chain.

Colorado Springs is fortunate to have a technology recycling center like Blue Star. The staff made it easy to drop off my computer, laptop and hard drives. Their prices are cheap compared to other communities and they guarantee that your drives are wiped. I totally recommend this service. I'll be bringing more tech stuff here.

I love the fact they recycle VHS tapes. I took over 100 lbs of them in and they took all of them. I lived in Germany for 4 years in the late 80's and early 90's and my family back home recorded my favorite shows and sent them to me on VHS. Then I did not know what to do with them when I got back. They were so very helpful!
I love this place! Great customer service and they recycle so many things..I love that I can recycle a blow dryer and a toaster here and they will take the time to answer your questions!

As a former employee of Blue Star Recyclers, this company is solving a multi-faceted problem (recycling hard to recycle items---that should not be going in the trash or landfill, creating meaningful employment for a segment of our population that faces 90% unemployment rate, and alleviating the tax payer burden for gov't funded services). This is a pure social enterprise model with a real "call to action" message. Think before you throw out your electronics or donate them to Goodwill. And definitely consider those e-waste recyclers who can't provide paperwork for your hard drives and equipment. They might be shadier than you think. 
This is real change at the local level and all my electronics from here on out will go to support Blue Star's mission.

We came here a couple weeks ago, we were looking for breakfast and thought we'd try this place. The service was quick and friendly, but the food was unfortunately not all to my liking. The bacon wasn't fully crispy and the pancake tasted a tad bit undercooked. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the hash browns tasted fine as well. I would've liked a little more seasoning/flavor, but it seems like they cater to an older crowd who I know does not typically like seasoning/flavor. It wasn't a horrible experience, but given a choice I unfortunately would not return.

Food is mediocre. Tried the dinner menu and was underwhelmed. Horrible texture on meatloaf, and if you want gravy on the meatloaf it cost $1.65 extra...since when does meat loaf not come with gravy? I think I will try breakfast next time, but I won’t be having dinner there again. Staff is very personable and the patrons are interesting in a good way, which is why I gave them an extra star. Food alone would be a two star review.
Just a great old school diner! Friendly staff and great service. Roast beef, mashed potatoes, patty melts, and all the good stuff.

Delicious food and great service. Restaurant has recently moved to larger location (off of Garden of the Gods), and employees are working hard to keep the customers satisfied and fed. They are quite impressive, and really go out of their way to make sure you are satisfied when you leave. It's great to get the same friendly and helpful customer care and same vibe as they had at the smaller location (when they were on Nevada Ave). I know this place will REALLY be hoppin' once they get more established and back into their well-known and very impressive groove. As it is now, it is a great place to take the family any night or day of the week. You can expect a friendly server that will truly make your meal a pleasure, and the visit is always a relaxed, yet professional, experience. ❤️
Great people - super chill staff. Awesome food at a great price. Relocating. I hope their new digs don't interfere with their friendly service.

This place is a hidden jem in the heart of town. Eaten there many times and never leave hunger. No european or foo foo portions here. Take a good appetite and enjoy some real comfort food. Highly recommend this place
Service was ok. Pork in green chili was under cooked to almost raw in center. The fruit was dry as if it was not fresh cut. The cook was not wearing a hair net while preparing food.
My aunt owned it. I always lobed the quality.

Oh man I dont have enough nice things to say. Great atmosphere, AMAZING FOOD and I mean AMAZING!! it is a little hole in the wall but the scenery is awesome and they even have a volley ball sand court in the back! So good!!

One of the best and juiciest hamburgers I have ever had. The wings that are fried and then grilled... AMAZING! These wings had heat, but also a sweet taste, not that burning your lips and gums kinda flavor. (Although there are different kinds of wings, if you want that.) The nachos for sure can be split between two people. Shawn our bartender... was super friendly and took care of us. Inside has a cool vibe, its been around a while and has that welcome we have a history to us (a story to tell), a worn in kinda look and we loved that! You want to order food go to the counter (at the end if the bar). They will call your name when its ready. You want a drink go to the bar and you can also get your beers in a bucket! We will be back.
Amazing wings! Definitely suggest double dip. O'Furry fries are bomb! Karaoke was great; just an overall good time!

I hadn't been here in 3yrs. Woke up this morning wanting some good wings. Remembered my last experience here and was in the truck. Now to those who value a good wing, these folks actually fry them as part of the process so that they get just the right amount of crispy. Hard to find good wings here in the Springs.. Most are just baked n sauced. The extra effort puts these folks a step above. Bartender guy was on point. Food took a little while but it's worth being patient. The wings were exactly what I got in my truck and drove for. Music was a good vibes mix. Patron mix was just that. A mix of folks of all walks who know this gem of a place exists. Atmosphere is exactly what I personally like in a bar, weathered, eclectic, n cozy, but not a dive. Not bright, but just right. Some tvs, but not a "multimedia experience". I had a good time and expect it'll be alot sooner than 3 yrs before I'm back again.
Favorite place for wings. The staff is always friendly and helpful. I have alot of fun everytime I eat here. The decoration is pretty neat too.

Nice staff and good food. A fun local (Falcon) place to hang out. They have a bunch of TVs all with different sports on. There is a bar and normal dining area allowing different options. A good sports bar in town!

Had garlic wings and NY Strip. Terrific soup. 
Nice bar and grill. Local crowd and sports! 
Good selection of on tap beer, but needs a better selection of bourbons! Great place to have lunch after a summer's day ride and decent breakfast on select days too!
Much better than the original Frankie's on Powers. Reuben was great! Nothing fancy, just good food, good service.

Great service.  Price is good.   I would have given 5 stars, but the tortillas used for my street tacos simply fell apart into many pieces.   Turned in to a pile.   Tasty.   But couldn't hold it to eat it

Been here many times and the food has always been great! Heads up if you order to go, go to the left side of the bar when going to pick up. Last time I ordered to go, I went to the right side and didn't get noticed for 10 minutes. I moved over to the left side and got my food right away, but it was cold by that time.
Love this place. It’s our go to on Friday or Saturday nights for dessert and some live music. Chocolate covered macaroons are delectable.

Great little place to have a cold beer (or glass of wine).  Service is always good and food menu is an eclectic mixture of healthier items.  There's a nice outdoor patio area around back for those warmer days of spring, summer and fall.  Waitstaff is always very helpful and kind.

They have monthly $2.50 beer specials which are a great value and they have a bottomless coffee menu item for $2 that you just can't get anywhere else.

This is primarily patronized by locals and is definitely a hidden gem for those just passing through.
Great local Colorado Springs spot. Menu has GF and vegan options and the soup bar is really good. Great place to eat alone or meet up with a friend.
Great little place to relax, get a dessert, and catch up on conversation, in my favorite part of town.
I have no idea what bright by there and if I had a choice I'd like to go there I already have it on my list so contact me back when I'm inside the building

Food was okay but atmosphere was cool. Staff was great!!! We of course sat in the airplane, which we didn't know before hand was even an option. We will definitely be back and give the food another try. This place is great for old and young!!!

Discovered this place and am so glad I did! This is a totally unique dining experience, and Christa, my flight attendant, was just awesome. Knowledgeable, efficient, and very upbeat & friendly. My food was excellent; well prepared and delivered in a timely manner. 
After lunch, I whiled away the afternoon at the bar, where Valerie, the bartender, proved to be a delightful conversationalist. 
I highly recommend this place to anyone looking, not just for a meal, but an experience.

Attention ladies and gentlemen, This is your review captain speaking. Set your courses for this restaurant, be sure to fasten your seatbelts and prepare your taste buds for takeoff. There's a bit of turbulence when it comes to flavor as everything was a bit bland but the atmosphere and the vibe was a smooth landing. A bit odd playing airport noises in the bathroom, not to mention the urinals we're about a mile high up. I have to give the most credit to the staff for dressing up like flight attendants and acting like we're going on a trip the whole time. Our waitress overheard us talking about my siblings birthday. She immediately came out with the birthday Sunday. Now, if that isn't first class service then I don't know what is. It would have been super cool if they came down the aisle with a little cart of miniatures for the patrons and they can order like they're on a real plane. Surely you need to stop here. 

You - "I will stop... And don't call me Shirley."
american food here - super good. Great spot for an appetite of any size. This place has a cool feel to it. Reminds me of a place in New York I liked to visit.

Went to eat here with my daughter whom was visiting from out of town. This was my 1st time. I truly enjoyed the fact you can be seated inside a airplane used during a war. The food was very good. Unfortunately the service was pretty slow that day. I think we might have come during the shift change but hey it gave us more time to look at all the history they had hanging on the walls. I would recommend you at least try it once. I will definitely be back again. I would give 5 stars but the service was real slow.
